info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Elbert, southern Hart and southwestern Abbeville Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1029 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northeast of Elberton, or near Russell State Park, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elberton, Calhoun Falls, Bowman, Lowndesville, Russell State Park, Nancy Hart State Park, Middleton, Lake Russell, Royston and Dewy Rose. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
